We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and findings suggest constrictive pericarditis. Pericardial knock is a classic physical finding in patients with constrictive pericarditis, and is caused by abrupt cessation of ventricular filling when the stiff pericardium stops further expansion of the ventricles during early-to-mid diastole. Absent jugular venous pulse y descent is associated with tricuspid stenosis, while pulsus parvus et tardus is a finding associated with aortic stenosis. Fixed split second heart sound is seen in atrial septal defect.

A pericardial knock is a characteristic sound in constrictive pericarditis caused by sudden cessation of ventricular filling due to abrupt cessation of cardiac expansion by the restricting pericardium. Absent jugular venous pulse y descent is seen in tricuspid regurgitation or right ventricular failure. Pulsus parvus et tardus is seen in aortic stenosis. Fixed split second heart sound is seen in atrial septal defect.
